alert.note: Alert for East Honolulu; Kauai East; Kauai North; Koolau Windward; Olomana (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued July 18 at 5:16PM HST until July 19 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND MAUI MOLOKAI AND KAHOOLAWE THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF OAHU AND KAUAI THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .Tropical Storm Calvin will rapidly generate warning level surf tonight into Wednesday morning for exposed east facing shores of the Big Island and most of Maui County, then quickly subside through the rest of Wednesday as Calvin moves further west away from the Big Island. Surf will build tonight into early Wednesday morning for east facing shores of Kauai and Oahu, generating advisory level surf through Wednesday before lowering into Thursday morning. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large and disorganized waves building to 7 to 12 feet by Wednesday morning. * WHERE...East facing shores of Kauai and Oahu. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.

area.areaDesc: East Honolulu; Kauai East; Kauai North; Koolau Windward; Olomana
